author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: يا مَنْ كُلُّ شَيْءٍ مُضطَرِبٌ مِنْ خَشْيَتِكَ، وَكُلُّ الوُجُوهِ ساجِدَةٌ عِنْدَ ظُهُوراتِ أَنْوارِ وَجْهِكَ، وَكُلُّ الأَعْناقِ خاضِعَةٌ لِسَلْطَنَتِكَ، وَكُلُّ القُلُوبِ مُنْقادَةٌ لِحُكُومَتِكَ، وَكُلُّ الأَركانِ مُضْطَرِبَةٌ مِنْ سَطْوَتِكَ، وَكُلُ الأَرْياحِ مُسَخَّراتٌ بِأَمْرِكَ، أَسْئَلُكَ بِنَفاذِ أَمْرِكَ وَاقْتِدارِكَ وَإِعْلآءِ كَلِمَتِكَ وَسُلْطانِكَ، بِأَنْ تَجْعَلَنا مِنَ الَّذِينَ ما مَنَعَتْهُمُ الدُّنْ
translation: O Thou the dread of Whom hath fallen upon all things, before the splendors of Whose face the countenances of all men are downcast, at the revelations of Whose sovereignty all necks have humbly bowed, to the ruling of Whose will all hearts have been subdued, the awfulness of Whose majesty hath caused the foundations of all things to tremble, and to the power of Whose authority the winds have been subjected! I beseech Thee by the compelling force of Thy Revelation, and by the power of Thy might, and by the exaltation of Thy word, and by the sublimity of Thy sovereignty, to number us with them whom the world hath been powerless to hinder from turning towards Thee.
